events.message: The policyholder reported a collision involving their vehicle and a tree on a wet road during the morning rush hour.
After preliminary review, the claim was classified under Auto Accident due to the nature of the incident and vehicle damage.
An agent with experience in vehicle accident claims was assigned to assist the customer promptly with their case.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment confirming receipt of the claim and outlining the next steps in the process.
The customer was requested to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates for further investigation.
The claimant promptly submitted all required documents including detailed images of the accident site and official police documentation.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence to validate the claim and assess liability and damage extent.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the collision was accidental and the submitted documents were consistent and complete.
A settlement offer was presented to the claimant based on repair costs and policy coverage limits with an option to negotiate.
The customer provided feedback on the proposed settlement, requesting clarification on certain billing details and coverage terms.
Following review of the negotiation, the claim was officially approved in full compliance with the insurance policy terms.
The payment for vehicle repair was issued to the policyholderâ€™s bank account as per the approved settlement agreement.
The claim case was formally closed after confirmation that the payment was received and all issues resolved to customer satisfaction.
